means: 出价，投标( bid的现在分词 )

word_mean: 承包者按照招标要求提出报价，争取获得承包任务的工作。

sentence.Network_en: She is very clever at getting men to do her bidding!
sentence.Network_cn: 她很善于让男人听她的吩咐！

sentence.Network_en: At his bidding, the delegates rose and sang the national anthem.
sentence.Network_cn: 按照他的要求，代表们起立唱国歌。

sentence.Network_en: I don't think she is bidding to be Prime Minister again.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想她不会再次竞选首相。

jx.jx_en_mean: do what someone orders or requests, especially in a way considered overly slavish
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指奴颜婢膝地）服从某人，听命于某人，为某人效劳

entry.def: If you do something at someone's bidding, you do it because they have asked you to do it.

example.ex: At his bidding, the delegates rose and sang the national anthem.
example.tran: 按照他的要求，代表们起立唱国歌。

entry.def: If you say that someone does another person's bidding, you disapprove of the fact that they do exactly what the other person asks them to do, even when they do not want to.

example.ex: She is very clever at getting men to do her bidding!
example.tran: 她很善于让男人听她的吩咐！

means.word_mean: 1. an authoritative direction or instruction to do something
3. (bridge) the number of tricks a bridge player is willing to contract to make
